verses.verse: Moreover take<WH5375> you up a lamentation<WH7015> for the princes<WH5387> of Israel,<WH3478>

And say,<WH559> What<WH4100> is your mother?<WH517> A lioness:<WH3833> she lay<WH7257> down<WH7257> among<WH996> lions,<WH738> she nourished<WH7235> her whelps<WH1482> among<WH8432> young<WH3715> lions.<WH3715>
And she brought<WH5927> up one<WH259> of her whelps:<WH1482> it became<WH1961> a young<WH3715> lion,<WH3715> and it learned<WH3925> to catch<WH2963> the prey;<WH2964> it devoured<WH398> men.<WH120>
The nations<WH1471> also heard<WH8085> of him; he was taken<WH8610> in their pit,<WH7845> and they brought<WH935> him with chains<WH2397> to the land<WH776> of Egypt.<WH4714>

Now when she saw<WH7200> that she had waited,<WH3176> and her hope<WH8615> was lost,<WH6> then she took<WH3947> another<WH259> of her whelps,<WH1482> and made<WH7760> him a young<WH3715> lion.<WH3715>
And he went<WH1980> up and down among<WH8432> the lions,<WH738> he became<WH1961> a young<WH3715> lion,<WH3715> and learned<WH3925> to catch<WH2963> the prey,<WH2964> and devoured<WH398> men.<WH120>

And he knew<WH3045> their desolate<WH490> palaces, and he laid waste<WH2717> their cities;<WH5892> and the land<WH776> was desolate,<WH3456> and the fullness<WH4393> thereof, by the noise<WH6963> of his roaring.<WH7581>

Then the nations<WH1471> set<WH5414> against<WH5921> him on every<WH5437> side<WH5439> from the provinces,<WH4082> and spread<WH6566> their net<WH7568> over<WH5921> him: he was taken<WH8610> in their pit.<WH7845>

And they put<WH5414> him in ward<WH5474> in chains,<WH2397> and brought<WH935> him to the king<WH4428> of Babylon:<WH894> they brought<WH935> him into holds,<WH4686> that his voice<WH6963> should no<WH3808> more<WH5750> be heard<WH8085> on the mountains<WH2022> of Israel.<WH3478>
Your mother<WH517> is like a vine<WH1612> in your blood,<WH1818> planted<WH8362> by the waters:<WH4325> she was fruitful<WH6509> and full of branches<WH6058> by reason of many<WH7227> waters.<WH4325>

And she had<WH1961> strong<WH5797> rods<WH4294> for the scepters<WH7626> of them that bore<WH4910> rule,<WH4910> and her stature<WH6967> was exalted<WH1361> among<WH5921> <WH996> the thick<WH5688> branches,<WH5688> and she appeared<WH7200> in her height<WH1363> with the multitude<WH7230> of her branches.<WH1808>

But she was plucked<WH5428> up in fury,<WH2534> she was cast<WH7993> down to the ground,<WH776> and the east<WH6921> wind<WH7307> dried<WH3001> up her fruit:<WH6529> her strong<WH5797> rods<WH4294> were broken<WH6561> and withered;<WH3001> the fire<WH784> consumed<WH398> them.
And now<WH6258> she is planted<WH8362> in the wilderness,<WH4057> in a dry<WH6723> and thirsty<WH6772> ground.<WH776>

And fire<WH784> is gone<WH3318> out of a rod<WH4294> of her branches,<WH905> which has devoured<WH398> her fruit,<WH6529> so that she has no<WH3808> strong<WH5797> rod<WH4294> to be a scepter<WH7626> to rule.<WH4910> This<WH1931> is a lamentation,<WH7015> and shall be for a lamentation.<WH7015>
